page.title: 13TRADE _ The Forge
page.content: { The forge is at the top of Essendon hill. It used to be about ten yards down the road on the opposite side of the road. Its been going for over 100 years. They used to shoe horses and make farm machinery but the farmer now gets his machinery from factories and the farrier shoes the horses. At the forge they make railings, stairs and gates and mend things. Their work is very dangerous from all the sparks and sharp metal. They dont need protective clothing except for eye protectors and hard tough shoes. The blacksmith needs five years training. The forge has a guillotine that can cut metal 6mm thick. There were some rollers to curve the metal and a bending machine to make angles. There are six workers and two in the office. None live in the village and they work from 8am to 6.30pm.Some work is sent abroad.
